Description of incident: Nearly a year ago, hackers broke              into a computer server that contained Social Security numbers and              a very limited amount of credit card information for              graduates of University of Massachusetts. Hackers gained access to              one server on the university's computer system, which held information              of students who attended UMass between 1982 and 2002, as well as a              few who attended before 1982. A UMass spokesman declined to say how              many people's records were exposed, except that it was a              large number of undergraduate and graduate students who attended              the university during the 20-year period.
